alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 8:26PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall over central and southern portions of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon burn scar is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, Mora and San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 824 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, El Porvenir, Tierra Monte, Sapello, Gascon, Montezuma, Ledoux, Morphy Lake State Park, Storrie Lake State Park, La Cueva, San Ignacio in Guadalupe County, Rociada, Manuelitas, Gallinas, South Carmen and Mineral Hill. - This includes the following low water crossings... West Las Vegas High School, Mills Bridge and Valencia Street. This includes the following recreation areas... E.V. Long Campground, El Porvenir Campground, Morphy Lake State Park and Storrie Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 18. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 26. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 344 and 347. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 2...and between Mile Markers 4 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon fire burn area.
